subject: PE Today: A Fake Lesley Stahl Hits YouTube
body:
CBSNews.com












Cindy 
      Sheehan Says GoodbyeHollywood couldn't have cast someone 
      better for her particular niche in the debate over the
war. But Sheehan wasn't the woman that members of the media seemed to want her to be. And so theygradually stopped paying much attention. 
      [+ Read More]

Critics 
      Take On "60 Minutes" – With The Help Of YouTubePoint2 
      Technologies produced a parody 
      of a "60 Minutes" piece called 
      "16 Minutes," and then, naturally, posted it on YouTube. Featuring "Lesley 
      Stool" in the form of a man in a blond wig, it presents customers of online real estate company 
      Redfin as morons and suggests that 
      "60 Minutes" portrayed the company in a positive light despite facts 
      suggesting otherwise. [+ Read More]

Hurricane 
      HugoThe bulging ranks of cable news critics saw their ranks 
      grow by another member yesterday: None other than Venezuelan President 
      Hugo Chavez. Welcome, El Presidente. Now settle down. [+ Read More]
